content: basic bed socks these simple socks are an easy introduction for new sock knitters or a quick and chunky bed sock for those that know what they are doing the socks are worked from the toe up using circular needles and magic loop and have a mitred short row heel there may be some new techniques that you will need to look up but they will be a great addition to your knitting toolkit sizes eur size 36 38 40 or 22 5 24 25 cm or whatever length you like yarn approximately 60g-100g of 8ply yarn our sample fits a size 41 and weighs 80g per pair needles 3 25-3 50mm 80cm circular needles depending on your gauge optional 80cm circular needle 1 or 2 sizes smaller for tighter ribbing gauge 24 sts x 35 row to 10cm materials yarn needle for sewing in ends abbreviations sts stitches kfb knit front and back knit into the front loop but k knit don t pull stitch off left needle move right p purl needle around and knit into the back loop finish round round work across both front and back needles stitch rs right side ds double stitch this is part of the german short ws wrong side row method see below sl1 slip one stitch 1 designed by emily bolduan © maker maker 2019 techniques you may need to look these techniques up there are many good videos and tutorials available online  judy s magic cast on  magic loop or use double pointed needles  use of a lifeline can be used as a save point that you can undo back to thread a yarn needle with a fine contrasting yarn preferably cotton or dental floss works surprisingly well and thread through the live stitches on your needles cut thread leaving a small tail and tie ends together if you need to undo your knitting just unravel until you hit the lifeline and slip the held stitches onto your needles  german short row heel see below for written instructions but watching a video is recommended  jeny s surprisingly stretchy bind off decrease bind off or any other stretchy bind off that you find it s good to experiment german short row double stitch  to work the double stitch on the wrong side with yarn in front slip the next stitch purl-wise pull yarn back over the right needle and around to the front of work to purl the next stitch this will have created a stitch that has two strands next to each other  on right side bring yarn to front of work slip the next st on the needle purl-wise pull yarn back over the top of right needle ready to knit the next st if you are a visual learner you may wish to look up a video pattern the toe using judy s magic cast on cast on 8 sts on to both the front needle and the back
